official_title: A Phase III Clinical Trial Evaluating De-Escalation of Breast Radiation for Conservative Treatment of Stage I, Hormone Sensitive, HER-2 Negative, Oncotype Recurrence Score Less Than or Equal to 18 Breast Cancer
brief_title: De-Escalation of Breast Radiation Trial for Hormone Sensitive, HER-2 Negative, Oncotype Recurrence Score Less Than or Equal to 18 Breast Cancer (DEBRA)
cancer_type_display: A trial for patients aged 50-70 with Stage I, hormone-sensitive, HER-2 negative breast cancer and a low Oncotype Recurrence Score (â‰¤ 18).
prior_treatments_excluded: Radiation therapy for the currently diagnosed breast cancer
Chemotherapy for the currently diagnosed breast cancer
Biotherapy for the currently diagnosed breast cancer
History of non-breast malignancies within 5 years
Current therapy with any endocrine therapy such as raloxifene, tamoxifen, or other SERMs

key_inclusion_summary: Patient must be between 50 and 70 years old.
Must have undergone a lumpectomy with histologically free margins.
Tumor must be Stage I (pT1, pN0), hormone receptor-positive (ER/PgR+), and HER2-negative.
Must have an Oncotype DX Recurrence Score of 18 or less.
key_exclusion_summary: Definitive clinical or radiologic evidence of metastatic disease.
Any node-positive disease (pN0(i+), pN0(mol+), pN1, pN2, or pN3).
Prior treatment with radiation therapy, chemotherapy, or biotherapy for the current breast cancer.
History of non-breast malignancies (with some exceptions) within 5 years prior to enrollment.
